page.title: 09Employment LISVANE
page.content: Area largly rural part of Lisvane 'village'and Thornhill{housing}estate to south.Survey of a hundred house holds was made in Lisvane to discover where those of employable age worked and what was the nature of their employment.Of 155 working adults,only 6(3.9%)were employed in Lisvane /Thornhill,121(78.1%)in other parts of Cardiff,26(16.8%)in other cities in U.K. &2(1.3%)in other countries.It was concluded that people lived in the pleasant {dormitory suburb} of Lisvane & travelled to work else where. The decline of farming occured when land was lost to the motorway or was bought up for possible future housing development.Some land still used for grazing sheep,cattle or horses. {Employment classification:}153 of those employed,98.7%,in tertiary indu- stries&2,1.3%,in secondary industries.
